com.prasannjeet.battleship.model

Class GameInstance

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.prasannjeet.battleship.model.GameInstance

  • public class GameInstance
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Prasannjeet Description: The primary class where the magic happens! It contains all the game data. Contains a battle board, ships, the username, etc. It initializes the board with random ship positions. This model is updated every time a player or their opponent makes a move. It also tells the client whether a player has won the match or not.

    • Field Detail

      • userId

        private java.lang.String userId
        The userId of the player. Autogenerated to a new random value every time the player starts a new game. Is not the key-value for this model.

      • userName

        private java.lang.String userName
        The username of player. Is the key-value for this model.

      • battleBoard

        private BattleBoard battleBoard
        One instance of battle board, which will contain 64 instances of battle cell.

      • ships

        private java.util.List ships
        List of ships. Will contain 5 different ships.

      • attackedShips

        private int attackedShips
        Contains value from 0 to 15. One for each cell. As all the five ships amount to 15 cells. The name should probably be changed to attackedCells. Will be done in future updates. //TODO

      • wonGames

        private int wonGames
        This shows the number of times this user has won games. Unlike other variables above that change every time the user plays a new game. This values persists and increases if the player wins a game.

      • lostGames

        private int lostGames
        Similar to the wonGames entry. This variable shows the number of times the user lost games.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameInstance

        public GameInstance(java.lang.String userId,
                    java.lang.String userName)
        Initializing the board with random ship positions. Used by both players 1 and 2. Called only when a new user plays the game.
        Parameters:
        userId - User-Id of the player, which is generated in the controllers.
        userName - User-Name of the player which is given by the user itself in frontend.

      • GameInstance

        public GameInstance(java.lang.String userId,
                    java.lang.String userName,
                    int wonGames,
                    int lostGames)
        Initializing the board with random ship positions. This constructor is used if a recurring player joins the game. To this end, it is important to make sure the variables wonGames and lostGames persist the data.
        Parameters:
        userId - User-Id of the player, which is generated by the controllers.
        userName - User-Name of the players which is given by the user itself in frontend.
        wonGames - The number of times the user won a game, accessed by the controller from already existing instance.
        lostGames - The number of times the user lost a game, accessed by teh controller from already existing instance in the repository.

    • Method Detail

      • setRandomPositions

        public void setRandomPositions(BattleBoard battleBoard,
                               Ship ship)
        Used by the constructor to set random ship positions of the board. Can be used for a bigger board and more ship in future as well. However, if the ship is so large that it can never fit in a board, this method will enter in an infinite loop.
        Parameters:
        battleBoard - The board
        ship - The shp that needs to be allocated random position.

      • areCellsEmpty

        private boolean areCellsEmpty(int x,
                              int y,
                              boolean isHorizontal,
                              BattleBoard battleBoard,
                              int shipSize)
        Used by the setRandomPositions() method. It checks if a sequence of cells in a battle board are empty, so that a shp with a certain size can fit there.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of either the topmost or leftmost position of the ship, based on their position, either vertical or horizontal, respectively.
        y - The y-coordinate of either the topmost or leftmost position of the ship, based on their position, either vertical or horizontal, respectively.
        isHorizontal - Asks the caller whether the ship was placed horizontally or vertically.
        battleBoard - The battleboard.
        shipSize - The size of the ship.
        Returns:
        Boolean value whether all the cells are empty or not, so that the shp can be accommodated there.

      • returnRandomBoolean

        public boolean returnRandomBoolean()

      • enemyTurn

        public boolean enemyTurn(int coordinate)
        Performs a set of actions when an enemy attacks this battle board. Following actions are performed:
        1. The variable setAttackedByEnemy is set to be true.
        2. If the cell contained ship, the variable attackedShips is increased by one.
        3. The attack count of a ship that was in that cell is also increased. This variable is currentlyl not used in the implementation. However it can be used in the future.
        4. If the cell contained a ship, a true value is returned. Else false is returned.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - The coordinate of that cell. It is in int format which is later converted into x and y, as can be seen in the implementation.
        Returns:
        Boolean value whether the cell contained a ship or not.
